qas.question: Genetic studies show that Jews bear their strongest resemblance to the peoples of where?
How far back does the Jews' shared common genetic pool date?

What people do Jews show the least genetic resemblance to?
How far back does the people of the Fertile Crescent's shared genetic pool date?

context: Genetic studies on Jews show that most Jews worldwide bear a common genetic heritage which originates in <b5_0>the <a2_0>Middle East<b5_0/><a2_0/>, and that they bear their strongest resemblance to the peoples of the <a0_0><b3_0>Fertile Crescent<b3_0/><a0_0/>. The genetic composition of different Jewish groups shows that Jews share a common genetic pool dating back <a1_0><b4_0>4,000 years<b4_0/><a1_0/>, as a marker of their common ancestral origin. Despite their long-term separation and beside their shared genetic origin, Jews also maintained a common <b6_0>culture<b6_0/>, tradition, and <b7_0>language<b7_0/>.
